Reviews.Title: “excellent location, clean, free wifi, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kiriakos_Dam
Reviews.Content: excellent location exactly next to metro station. a supermarket and a bakery. Breakfast is not a problem u r exactly next to a very cheap and delicious bakery. Distance is not a problem exactly next to metro station (5 stops to Alexanderplatz). Free wifi. Clean and good value for money On the other hand average service one day they forgot to clean room but they compensate with a free basket of fruits. No facilities (swimming pool etc.) there is a lack of kitchennette, the room is small and the view is a little depressing. I sure recommend it because u r in Berlin, u want to wander and u have what you really want (location, metro, value for money etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Robert G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a 4-day vacation in Berlin. This hotel has been one the best of Best Western hotels we have ever stayed. The hotel is well situated just next to the U-Bahn, 5 stops to the city center, in an area with many shops and restaurants. A big supermarket is situated on the ground floor of the hotel building. Our room was very clean, towels were changing every day. Breakfasts were rich and very tasty, I strongly recommend to have breakfasts in the hotel. I would definitelly stay in this hotel next time in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Location makes it a perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lovebirds9187
Reviews.Content: The hotel door is only 5 secs from the U-bahn entrance (Samaristrabe Line U-5). So getting to Alexanderplatz and other attractions in Berlin is not a biggie. The service you get at reception is excellent. We were satisfied with our room. They have a TV, Mini-bar, desk and chairs in room. Sleep quality was good (Tip: ask for a room that is not facing the main street).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: daleteeps
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and basic. It is in a fantastic location with relaxed but cool bars and great places to eat veris ear by. The hotel is right on the underground so its easy to explore with an A and B zone ticket. There is no tea making facility which is really the only downside. It's bar is tiny and whilst I would not say it is a destination hotel it is a fabulous base to explore from. Being on the U Bahn to main stations means we could leave our bags in the lockers at Alexanderplatz before getting the airport express on the day of departure. If you want clean, comfortable and brilliantly located, this place is a good option for a budget stay. Wi fi did not work in our room but there are two computors in the lobby. Don't bother with breakfast, so many cheap places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rajendra24
Reviews.Content: Positives 1. value for money 2. Basic but clean 3. Only a hop and a step away from the U bhan station samariterstr 4. close to shops and restaurants 5. Powerful shower Negatives 1. Air con not very effective 2. If the window is open very noisy due to proximity to frankfurter alee Tips 1.Pay 5 euro deposit at the reception to get a kettle to have tea/coffee making facility at the room 2.rooms not facing the road may be quiter

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SDTrav12
Reviews.Content: So as not to come across as completely negative, I'll start with the (few) good things. First, the entrance to the U-Bahn is practically right outside the door to the hotel, making travelling by the underground extremely convenient. Second, the bathroom was a good size and very modern and bright. For us, the positives ended there. When we went to go to bed the first night, we found the sheets on our bed were dirty...they had obviously not been replaced since the previous occupant had left (I'll spare you the details). Because it was very late, we decided to wait until morning, pulled the covers up, spread towels from the bathroom on top (we had no way of knowing if the duvet covers had been changed either), and had a bit of an uncomfortable sleep. The next morning, I complained to the staff at the front desk and asked someone to make sure the beds and room were properly cleaned during the day. The staff seemed a bit indifferent to my concerns but assured me the matter would be looked after. When we returned that night, we got to our room to find a couple of folded sheets left on the foot of the bed, and the dirty sheets still place. Although it was again late, this time we did complain immediately. We were told there was no cleaning staff on duty at night but they'd see what they could do. Eventually, one of the front-desk staff did come up and changed the sheets herself, which I appreciated; but it was still unacceptable that it took two days to get obviously dirty sheets changed. In general, we did not find staff very engaging, friendly, or responsive. The hotel's immediate location is not very attractive (although if you take a walk through the surrounding neighborhood, you'll find some interesting nooks and crannies). Overall, and given our experience, this is not a place I would recommend to anyone to stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: luciend
Reviews.Content: great hotel. in front of metro station and little supermarket 24hours open. clean, good rooms, great staff, great sleep, notjing to reclaim. i would back again

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, good location, nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: iheartearth
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't particularly glamorous or interesting but it's excellent value for money, is situated in front of a tube line that goes straight into the centre of town, has a great bakery next door that sells wonderful pastries and coffee, and is clean, orderly and pleasant inside. If you are looking for a base whilst you explore Berlin then you could do far, far worse than this hotel. It's situated on the fashionable East side of the Wall and although the area it's based in isn't particularly interesting, the tube stop right outside the hotel door means you are just 5 minutes away from Alexanderplatz and the rest of Berlin...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and well located”
Reviews.Author: Watlingbob
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, quiet and handily placed next to bakers, restaurants and small shops. Staff are polite and most helpful. A Neto supermarket is nearby. There is a U-Bhan station right by and this line takes you directly to Alexanderplatz from where you can easily get to anywhere in Berlin. You can get a great breakfast at La Mer Noire, which you find by turning left out of the hotel, crossing the road and walking a couple of hundred yards or so. We chose a hotel in old East Berlin because I think the east has more character and "feel"of old Berlin. This hotel provided the perfect base for a busy four day trip. Easy to reach from Schonefeld Airport (costs only 3 Euros)

Reviews.Title: “Great position, excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Kamema
Reviews.Content: Right outside a metro stop, nice bakery next door. Lovely rooms, pleasant staff - this is a great place to stay if you want to explore Berlin as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “BEST WESTERN Hotel City Ost”
Reviews.Author: Ljuba_Shumkova
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, close to U-bahn. For 5 EUR deposit they give you a tea/coffee kit.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rusty1987
Reviews.Content: This is the second time ive stayed here and both times it's been fantastic. Clean, friendly staff, free wifi throughout. Tube stop about two feet from the front door and only a few stops to alexanderplatz. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: bosa1975
Reviews.Content: Price has always been the first criteria for my choices when I decide to stay in a specific hotel. This hotel is in a very convenient location right next to a metro station. Worst case it will take you max 10 minutes to get to the city center in Berlin, Alexanderplatz. The price of the hotel is acceptable but you have to pay some extras like parking and breakfast. In both cases the prices were not overpriced when you compare with other hotel rates. There is parking space right in front of the hotel for 2 cars. It is free of charge during the night time but during the day it is 0.25 Euros for 15 min. So We decided to use the hotels parking space for a daily base and it was 12 Euros which is a good price in a city like Berlin. The other hotels mostly charge 20 Euros on a daily basis. The breakfast was good but not excellent but it was very convenient for us because we eat good mostly on breakfast and enjoy the rest of our trip with just a snack later not to lose any time. The breakfast is 9 Euros and worths every penny. There are some supermarkets next and across the hotel and when you need something it is just a 5 minute walk from the hotel. There is even a market 24 hours open. You can buy fruits.. cold beer.. even some international food which can give you a taste of home in a foreign land. The hotel carpets looked kind of messy when we arrived to the hotel but later on a professional staff did a good cleaning. The bathroom was designed very effeciently. There was a small radiator in the bathroom which you could set it for a 2 hours to make your wet towels dry. There was a special shaving mirror which I believed is a must in every bathroom as well. The gummy bear candies were a good surprise for our 2 year old daughter. Shortly, I would say it was not the best hotel I have ever stayed but I would say it was one of the best bargains I have ever made. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who does not need so much comfort but still be in the heart of city with a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good address”
Reviews.Author: vincextras
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival and until us leaving the hotel 3 days later, the staff has been really nice, helpful and provided excellent guidance in order to enjoy the city and the local treats. Will go back for sure ...

Reviews.Title: “Great for transport”
Reviews.Author: travellers338
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for a 3 night stay and were impressed with it's location. You get off the U5 underground train and head for the exit in the direction the train was travelling. Take the exit on the left and the hotel is directly in front of you!!! Perfect. There is a Lidl diectly next door for cheap/good bottles of wine and beer. We ate at the San Diego steak restaurant which you acces by turning left out of the hotel, follow the building line to the left,, turn left up the first street, walk 100 mtrs and it is there in front of you. The beef goulash soup was the best I have had and a 2 course meal for two with drinks cost 30 euros.....Excellent value. Really busy when we arrived at 7.30pm and stayed full whilst we were in. We also ate at the Mona Lisa Italian Restaurant which you access by turning right out of the hotel and walk approx 100 meters. Again the meal for two with drinks averaged 30 Euros. Very good value and was really filling. We used the underground every day for transport around Berlin and bought a day ticket for 6 euros. It was a fabulous trip and would recommend this hotel for it's location, cleanliness and friendly reception staff. Well done best western. We intend returning next year and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for going out in Friedrichshain”
Reviews.Author: Arlette v
Reviews.Content: Do: If you're into exploring Friedrichshain, take this hotel. Nothing better than your hotel closeby at 5am. Rooms are clean and comfy. Connection to the city is great, the U-bahn really stops in front of the hotel and takes you to Alexanderplatz in 5 minutes. For a €5,- depost you can get a cooker with coffee and tea for your room at the reception. Don't: Order breakfast in the hotel. This will cost you € 9,- a day. Next to the hotel there is a great bakery and two supermarkets as well. Don't rely on the wifi. We stayed on the 6th floor and reception was very bad.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: SofiaPRT
Reviews.Content: Room fine and clean. Staff nice. U-Bahn station at hotel’s door that takes you quickly and easily to the center (5 stations from Alexandraplatz). Free internet access at the lobby (2 computers) Very good bakery next door and also a supermarket and some fast food restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, we would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: Jenna1507
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel City Ost for 3 nights in October 2011. The hotel is very conveniently situated immediately outside the Samariterstrabe station (U5) which has a direct link to Aleanderplatz in less than 10 minutes. Use the exit for the road beginning with a V to get to the hotel as there are 4 different exits from the station. We had a front facing room on the 6th floor which was very spacious with a large bathroom, the room was spotless & fresh towels were available daily. The road outside is noisy and the air conditioning isn't the greatest but as the weather was relatively cool we were able to sleep with the window shut which blocked out all traffic noise. We only had breakfast on one morning as we ate from the local bakeries on the other days but the hotel breakfast was adequate with toast, cereals, fruit & bacon & eggs!!. The staff were excellent & couldn't help us enough with any queries we had. There are some great places to eat and drink in the local area, especially San Diagos steak house, turn right out of the hotel & walk no more than 10 minutes until just after the next tube station and the restaurant is on the right and Lebowski's bar turn right out of the hotel up to the first main set of traffic lights then turn left and the bar is about 4 down on the left. All in all for a cheap hotel (less than £50 per night for 2 people) we couldn't have been happier and would definately stay here again if we return to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good price”
Reviews.Author: well_fine
Reviews.Content: We were staying at this hotel for 4 nights. It was less than £50 per night and our price didn't include breakfast. However, there was a lovely bakery shop next door with cheap tasty pastry. A supermarket was only 1 shops away. A fruit market was across the road and opened till late. A U-bahn station was just right outside of the hotel, which was only 10 mins away from Alexander Plaza. The staff there were very helpful and efficient. Our room was very clean and spacious. Although it was facing the main street, you couldn't hear the traffic noise once you close the window. The pillow could be a bit uncomfortable so it might be good to pay extra 2 Euro for a better one. Free wifi was available and two computers with Internet at the Lounge. Kettle, mugs with tea and coffee was available when paying for a refundable deposit (5 Euro). Thanks to TA members' recommendation below and we were very pleased to choose this hotel. We definitely would recommend you to stay in this hotel when the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Das was good!”
Reviews.Author: dabberdabberdo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week for 5 nights. Location was very good, staff were friendly, room was fine and clean, a reasonable base for staying in Berlin. Our room was on the 4th floor and yes, on a couple of occasions during the night, you could hear the traffic as the road outside is a busy one. It was very warm in Berlin but the room had air conditioning and so we were able to close the windows and have the air conditioning on which worked perfectly. The room was a nice size and clean. There is free internet access, both wifi and with 2 computers in the lobby. We used the wifi daily and it worked fine and was very fast. We got a taxi from Tegal Airport which cost 26 euros and takes around 30-40 mins depending on traffic. You literally walk outside and take a few steps to the U-Bahn (underground). A day ticket costs just over 6 euros each. Takes around 10 minutes to Alexandraplatz. You can also walk there which takes around an hour but is quite pleasant. We took the U-Bahn to visit Sachsenhausen concentration camp (well worth a visit). We also used it to visit the Olympic Stadium and Spandau. There are a number of restaurants near the hotel, ranging from kebabs/burgers to steak houses. McDonals, Burger King and Subway are within a 5 minute walk too. I would highly recommend a visit to San Diego steak house - steak was lovely! There are number of cafes and bakers nearby and next door to the hotel is a Netto's which is cheap and handy for bottles of water or those late night snacks! I would recommend the hotel as a good location, good price and with free wifi thrown in, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “great place with an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: boobrown
Reviews.Content: the best thing about this hotel is the location, on the u5 line and only 5 stops to Alexanderplatz which is pretty much central Berlin. The rooms are comfy (the pillows were amazing) and i had a great nights sleep every night, also considering you are on a main road it was silent in the room. the shower was roomy and had great water pressure. The air con was also a bonus as it was 28 degrees in Berlin at the night. Another great bonus of this hotel, free wifi, was really handy during my trip. There is a netto next store and also a bakery, would defiantly stay here again and would recommend to any of my friends who wanted to go to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: helentam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at a place with restaurants and the metro station right outside of the hotel.It is about 5 stops to the city center.Although on a central road located,you do not hear the noise,if the windows are closed.The breakfast was also very good.Our room was comfortable and clean.You can also have internet access on one of the computers at the reception.Some receptionists are willing to help but some other not so willing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, price and location”
Reviews.Author: CobberLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated right next to a U Bahn station; there are lots of restaurants and bars near by; the hotel itself was clean and breakfast was great: what a find!

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: misscherry17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in late August. As all reviews mention, U Bahn train station (Samariterstrabe) is right outside. Supermarket is 2 doors down which was handy. Train ride is about 10mins from city centre (Alexanderplatz station). Room was very good size, quite spacious, clean and modern. We put the 'Do not disburb' sign on our door, and housekeeping left a bag with all towels, toilet paper, etc. Free use of internet on computers in reception.

Reviews.Title: “Nice value hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1AvidTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a bit far from the city center but there is an U-Bahn stop literally just outside the door. There is a bakery on one side and a little market on the other, as well. Our room was a decent size for a European hotel, though the bathroom was as usual quite small. Front desk staff were okay...some very friendly, others not so much. The breakfast is good but we had it automatically included and I wouldn't suggest paying more than 5-8 Euro per person for it. All in all everything was clean and pleasant. As usual the A/C was practically nonexistent but our window did open quite wide and it wasn't too hot in Berlin during our stay. As a note, a direct cab from the airport cost us 28 Euro (and we had to go a bit out of the way due to road closures for a local beer festival).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Melissa Z
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, clean and comfortable. Stayed there while on a Contiki tour and it was one of the better hotels. Good breakfast! I would recommend trying some of the chocolate muesli, it was amazing! Tried finding it in the shops with no luck... Decent restaurants a short walk away!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality but bad smell”
Reviews.Author: lottagus
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located along the long boulevard Frankfureter Allee, on which you could walk into the city center in about 40 minutes. There is an U-Bahn station right outside the entrance, though, so you could easily travel to Alexander Platz in ten minutes. The location was nice, a lot of east german buildings and interresting surroundings. Very close to Simon Dach Strasse and all the nice bars there. Also quite close to Volkspark Friedrichshein, a nice place to spend a sunny day. The room was nice, with a comfortable bed and a shoiwer. Unfortunatley the hallways smelled like people had been smoking in them for 30 years and someone had tried to cover up the smell with air fresheners. Not nice. Also, when you left the room with the wondows closed it had a bit of a murky smell when you came back.

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: whirledwanderer
Reviews.Content: the room was a little on the cosy side but the view was amusing and the hotel very handy to the U-bahn. a kettle had to be rented separately [apparently too many people have souveniered them in the past] .reasonably quick wireless internet was available

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rusty1987
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, has a metro right outside the door and only a few stops to alexanderplatz. When I go back to Berlin I'll definitely be staying here. Complimentary wifi in the lobby but not Internet in the room apart from wired. Love Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Very good price, great location”
Reviews.Author: jeveiga
Reviews.Content: The price is unbeatable: I have paid less than 40 euros for a double room in December. Same for the location: although not in the center, there's a U-Bahn station literally by the door, so within less than ten minutes you are on Alexanderplatz. The nighbourhood has plenty of shops and supermarkets. Would easily return.

Reviews.Title: “good location, value, and base for central berlin”
Reviews.Author: CMink
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, with helpful staff and overall good location. Great row of fab bars and restaurants a few minutes walk away - this is not full of tourists and is a nice way to spend a chilled out evening. Walking into alexanderplatz and main area of berlin takes around 20mins or about 7mins on the metro which has a station right outside the hotel - very convenient for that. There is also a supermarket 2 doors away so great if you like to pick up juice and croissants for the room!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again but sort your a/c out!”
Reviews.Author: mandb432
Reviews.Content: My wife and i are just back from staying 3 nights in this hotel. Apon arrival we were greeted by a friendly receptionist and when we got to our room on the 4th floor we were pleased when entering it,as it was clean,tidy and the decor was nice. Last sunday and monday in Berlin was over 30c and the heat inside was stifling so we had to keep our window open when we slept as the air conditioning was set very low and seemed ineffective. Thank goodness we were at the back of the building so we didnt have any traffic noise and could keep the window open. We discovered that if you kept one room key in the power slot and took the other one with us that the room was cooler when we got back. The room had a mini bar which was well stocked but quite expensive, so we removed the items and used the fridge to store water etc and then replaced the items when leaving. (i dont know if you are supposed to do this or not,but have read on TA about othere people doing the same) The u-bahn station is at the main door of the hotel and a netto discount store was next door. We enjoyed staying in the area and decided to stroll along karl marx allee towards alexanderplatz and were able to look at all the socialist realist style apartment blocks. The hotel is also close to the 1.3km of berlin wall still standing(east side gallery). Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice on my part...”
Reviews.Author: lamphs
Reviews.Content: Easy check-in and check-out, very clean room, the bed was comfortable, and the breakfast was good and plentiful. The only drawback was the air conditioning. I had it set to on, but the room was still slightly uncomfortable. While I prefer reading to watching television during downtime, if you are a television watcher, then the only available English channels were CNN and BBC. I thought the front desk were efficient, but not friendly. I was a little surprised that the front desk would not change a 50€ bill for me. I had a room on the back side, which does not provide a great view. On the other hand, the hotel is located on a main street that seemed to stay very busy at night. I did notice that the hotel rents bicycles. If you prefer to stay close to the hotel, there are plenty of small restaurants, convenience stores, and an enclosed shopping mall. Most importantly, the U-bahn station was immediately outside of the hotel. It is a few minute (less than 10) ride to Alexanderplatz. From Alexanderplatz, you can either walk, or easily transfer to another U-bahn, to anywhere you want. My only disappointment was the length of time it took to get from the airport (Tegel) to the hotel. I took the airport bus from Tegel (less than 2.3€) to Alexanderplatz and then took a cab from Alexanderplatz. In addition to some difficulty in finding a cab at Alexanderplatz, the total trip took 2 hours due to traffic (I left Tegel at 1:30 PM on a Friday). Another writer recommended the bus from Tegel to Alexanderplatz and then the U-bahn to the hotel. I had a considerable amount of luggage, so it was simply easier to take the cab. (The cab was less than 15 Euros.) The room did have a small safe, but not large enough to keep my small notebook computer. It also had a refrigerator, which was nice. Finally, there was wireless Internet available in the room, but it had a very weak signal, at least in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: affableguy
Reviews.Content: Reasonable location right outside the underground (U5) leading to Alexanderplatz. Room clean so no complaints there but a bit on the small side-need to watch you don't catch your knees while moving around the bed corners! Breakfast offered at 9 euros which we declined. Had no problem with the heat experienced by other guests;had a room at the rear- quiet away from the busy main road outside at the front.No rear view as such but interesting to watch from our third floor room all the down and outs scavenging for timber.lead copper etc being taken out of derelict flats that were being (slowly) renovated. Worst aspect was the reception staff who were generally rude/abrupt/unhelpful;for example-the hotel booklet said that tea and coffee making facilities could be obtained from reception and there was no charge.Brits like their cup of tea and so we duly went down to recetion to get the kit.The guy on recetion looked as if guests were an inconvenience to him but went off to get the kettle and said 5 eros please. I paused being somewhat confused as I thought it was free-he then said abruptly "Yes or No". Probably a communication problem on my part-I resisted the temptataion to say a few choice words as it later transpired that the 5 euros was a deposit and as long as you didn't nick the kettle you got it back. Other annoyances occurred during our 4 night stay but the worst was on the very last afternoon while we were back in the hotel foyer sorting our bags out for the journey back to the airport.I had had an operation quite recently for an abdominal problem plus I may have eaten something the night before which disagreed with my digestive system.The hotel advertised WC facilities were available on the first floor-they were locked however and reception's attitude was basically that they couln't care less. From my knowledge of law I suspect that this was illegal-the facilities were not shut because they were being cleaned (which is reasonable) but they were shut because it suited them that way. So take your choice-persoally I wouldn't stay here unless you like being bloody-minded and are prepared to make yourself really unpopular to get the service level you deserve.It was not as if we were paying budget prices-our 4 night stay cost 285 euros (with no breakfast) Perhaps if we had taken breakfast in the hotel then they might have been a bit more friendly towards us!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, good stay”
Reviews.Author: NJ26
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money, especially compared to other hotels in Berlin that charge the same as this but are not as nice. The room was pleasant and comfortable with a new flat screen TV - some scuff marks on the walls which need to be painted over though. The hotel is in the edgy and hip Friedrichshain district and I could have literally jumped from the window of the room into the U-Bahn station it was that close! Would come here again

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: kellyabra
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with a great location (hop, skip and a jump away from a metro stop). The front desk is very polite and helpful. The hotel is close to “fast food” restaurants and bakeries. Definitely worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean and modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: Craig4646
Reviews.Content: I visited Berlin for a weekend to view the sites and museums. I was looking to book just outside of the city centre to save costs. After reading reviews on trip advisor about this hotels location I decided to book my stay here. All I can say is you cannot beat this hotel on location and cost. It is literarily is only ten steps away from an underground station which takes you to Alexanderplatz in about 10 minutes. The rooms were clean and modern with normal satellite TV. This hotel has free wifi which I only used on my phone to check emails, and check maps but seemed adequate. Beds were of a reasonable standard. And breakfast was €9 and was adequate for this price. The only downside I have on the double beds, there is two single duvets; instead of one double duvet. This could annoy any couples planning on staying at this hotel, but the beds are together.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, just perfect, location can't be beaten.”
Reviews.Author: janewdc
Reviews.Content: The hotel entrance is literally on the metro entrance (when arriving by metro take the exit that has indicated a street that starts with a V, that's the correct exit since it was three other exits). It's just 5 stops to Alexanderplatz. Next to the hotel there's also a grocery store which is handy. The hotel is excellent. Staff is great and it's full of ammenities, the best of which is free wi fi in all the hotel. If you don't have your own device there's two computers in the lobby available at no extra cost with free printing too. The room is spotless clean and has hair dryer, safe box, minibar. It had a desk with chair and another smaller table.There's breakfast available at an extra cost and there's also laundry service available, plus they gave us a coupon for a free drink. We were really happy in this hotel. One of the most comfortable stays we've enjoyed in our many trips. I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location for people who want nightlife!”
Reviews.Author: cloglisci
Reviews.Content: Hotel is extremely clean, friendly staff that were helpful with directions with metro. Metro is right next to the hotel which was great. The hotel is right by the nightlife area that is filled with cafes and bars, they stay open all night you wont be disappointed!! There is a German bakery a few doors down that was great. good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: anna_c20
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend last year and would definitely stay at this hotel again. The location is great - the underground stop is just outside the hotel and that will take you to Alexanderplatz where you can change to travel all over Berlin. The area near the hotel has a really young feel to it with lots of cool bars and restaurants so you don't need to travel far at night. Some of the restaurants are really good value and it felt very safe walking back to the hotel at night. We had breakfast a couple of days at a bakery near the hotel where you can sit in and have a good breakfast with coffee for just a few euros. Would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lon2008
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the east of the city but is right next to the metro so getting into the centre is very easy. There are shops and restaurants nearby. Overall I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fmct01
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel during our stay in Berlin, literally out the front door is an underground station so very easy to get around, and nice bigs rooms and friendly staff. 5 minute walk to many restaurants and cafes and all round great place to stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job, close to underground, room clean,slept good.”
Reviews.Author: patrickcurran
Reviews.Content: Close to underground at door, room was nice and clean, our room was very quiet, bed comfortable, great shower lots of preasure and hot, no real faults would reommend to freind had coffee and crossants for breakfast for2€ enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: spudgungladiator
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here from 7th - 11th Feb. We had a room on the 3rd floor. First of all, the location of the hotel is fantastic. It's on Frankfurter Allee, and literally ten feet from Samariterstraße station which is on the U5 line (stops at Alexanderplatz within about 7 mins). Upon arrival, the receptionist was friendly and spoke very good English. Check in was done within a couple of minutes. Our room was spotless and obviously recently furbished. There was a small desk, wardrobe, two chairs, refrigerator, tv and bedside cabinets. The bathroom was very clean with a hair-dryer, soap dispenser by the sink and in the shower (it was nice soap too...). There was no bath, only a shower which had very good pressure and water temperature. There is a cheap Netto convenience store a couple of doors down from the hotel, so if you need to stock up on food or drink without paying hotel prices, just pop in there. It's also worth noting that there are two computers in the reception area with a printer - internet and printer usage is completely free. I recommend this hotel to anyone after a basic, clean and well located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is a clean, modern and well located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MardiNJ
Reviews.Content: Staff were helpful and spoke English. We had a "comfort room". This means a desk, a large bed and night tables. There were some lamps that worked by touch; we thought this was a very cool (good)feature. The bathroom was modern/recent with a shower (no tub) and warming towel racks. There was an initial mix-up and we got a smoking room. This was corrected right away and without any problem. This hotel is easy to miss if you come by cab as it is not on a corner and there is no big portico entrance. Thank goodness for the Best Western logo and colors. The hotel is right at entrance to the U Bahn 5 train at the Samariterstrasse stop. There is a bakery next door and a supermarket a few doors down. This was a good place to stay in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel - Great staff, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: venuslovesyou
Reviews.Content: This was great for a traveler on a budget. It was about a 2 minute walk to the subway (S-Bahn), which was 5 stops away from a main hub (Alexanderplatz). From Alexanderplatz you can easily get anywhere. The room was spotless and the staff was very helpful and friendly. My only warning is to non-smokers. They allow all guests to smoke in the rooms, so you should expect your room to smell like smoke. The smell did go away by about the 2nd day since we don't smoke. They have a small bar in the lobby where you can have a drink 24/7. They also have free wireless in the lobby (it's slow but who cares). I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Close enough and certainly good enough”
Reviews.Author: Bigbust
Reviews.Content: I was delighted with my 4th floor room which was at the back of the hotel. It was quiet and had really good facilities.Alexanderplatz is a stiff 25 minutes walk, but at this time of year,rewarded by a glass of punch. The Christmas Markets are a delight. Chris at the Gengarmenmarkt Market wont ask you how much rum you need - he will give you the bottle ! The transport network is excellent. The boys and girls speak fluent English- even the Americans. The Friedrichshain area has plenty of good bars.The 10 Euro's tourist bus great for whetting your appetite.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, very reasonable, close to metro- just what we needed.”
Reviews.Author: lillesommerfugl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a mini break to Berlin, and booked the hotel last minute. This hotel is not in the Mitte or close to the shopping district, but it is just next to a metro stop which takes you into the city centre in ten minutes, which was all we wanted. We had a wonderful time. The service was truly great, the staff friendly and helpful. We did not order the breakfast at the hotel. Instead we bought our own, either at the grocery store next door, or at the many cafes in Berlin which offer delicious breakfast options. Be aware that you have to ask for, and pay a deposit for a cable for the internet and the box with the coffee maker. We just asked for it at the front desk, paid the deposit and hey presto we were good to go. The deposit was returned to us promptly when we returned the cable and the box of coffee making goodies. We were originally given a room without a mini bar, but as we wanted to keep and refrigerate some food in the room, such as breakfast foods we asked if that was also something we needed to pay a deposit for, which it turned out it was not. They just dont have them in all room, it seems, so they moved us to another room with a mini bar immediately as we asked for it. For us this was a great place for our mini vacation. A little off the beaten path, yet so close to town that you can walk in. (It is a nice 45 mins about to walk to Alexanderplatz, and totally nice when the weather is good.) We like seeing other neighbourhoods besides the ones with all the touristy stuff in them, and this fit the bill perfectly. There is a grocery store, bakery, pharmacy, pizzeria, few other stores and restaurants as well as the metro stop just next or around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All in all good value - does the job”
Reviews.Author: gyulauhrin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights with my friend. Easy to find from Schoenefeld Airport and takes about 40 minutes to get back. Rooms are basic, but clean. Service could be better, Juliane in Breakfast Room was attantive and friendly. Free WiFi in Lobby only, but not vey good signal, good for checking emails on your phone or get travel information. Otherwise they have 2 computers in the Lobby with Internet if you want to do more. Room equipment is limited and be prepared to pay deposit for everything you require, we put half of our spending money in deposit for charger and tea box, etc., you get it back in the end. Location is very good, Alexanderplatz is only about 5 minutes on U5 underground and you can get around on foot from there, i.e. Brandenburg Gate is about 1 hour walk on the Unter den Linden, which is good for shopping. Checkpoint Charlie is about 15 minutes walk from Unter den Linden on Friderichstraße. There are some little shopping centres and restaurants in the area, so you don't need to get away far from the hotel in the evening. Metro & S-bhan runs frequently late into night, and even at 5 am to get back to the airport. All in all a good hotel if you are just looking for a short break accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good stay!!”
Reviews.Author: klee_baker
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel via lastminute.com for a 4 day break in Berlin. We flew into Berlin's Schoenefeld airport & used public transport to get to the hotel. It was the S7 Airport Express from Schoenefeld to Alexanderplatz (aboout 15 mins journey) and then the U5 from Alexanderplatz to Samaritestrasse which is where the hotel was located - the U Bahn stop is literally on the doorstep of the hotel - very convenient! We checked in with no issues - the staff spoke a number of languages (and despite me trying to speak German their English was clearly better!) We were put in a room on the 6th floor overlooking the main street. The room was very clean and there were 2 little welcome biscuits on the pillows when we got there. The bathroom was also very clean and consisted of shower, basin & toilet. I found the beds to be comfy (though some may find the matress to be hard). It was very cold outside in Berlin, but the room was very warm - sometimes too warm! Though there was the optionj of using air conditioning or opening the window. With the window open you could hear the traffic outside from the main road. We tried breakfast on the first morning we were there (9 Euros) and was not overly impressed with this. It was a buffet breakfast, we got there about 9 am and it was clear that the food had been out for a while! We didn't have breakfast there again but there were plenty of other places to eat in the area!! Many people mention the bakery next door to the hotel! There were also a number of takeaways, a Burger King, Netto etc in walking distance from the hotel! There is free internet in the lobby - they have 2 PCs set up to allow you to access the service, and the wifi is free if you have your own device to connect to it. All in all I would say that this was a good hotel - we both enjoyed the stay & would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: robrazil_81
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, fair rooms, very well-located. The metro station (Samaritestrasse) is 10 steps from the hotel and 5 stations from Alexanderplatz. The hotel is also very close to a supermarket. I would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - But Expected Better”
Reviews.Author: michelboulad88
Reviews.Content: We choose this Hotel my girlfriend and I because of the Reviews on Tripadvisor. I'm not saying I'm dissapointed, but we expected better. So let me start with the negative points: - Breakfast ain't so good - Stay could have been cheaper - A little bit outside of Berlin - Room is Small - Nothing Special about the Service But as for Positive Points: - Even though I said a little bit outside of Berlin, the Metro System is fantastic in Germany and there was a stop right under our doorstep - Bed is really comfortable - Room is clean

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrailsForever
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and found it to be a great location just steps from the Samariterstrasse U-Bahn station (you can be in Alexanderplatz in 10-15 mins). My spouse and I had a room at the back, my daughter and her boyfriend had a room at the front (overlooking Frankfurter Allee). The rooms were clean but we did find them very stuffy. We could open the windows but at night it was impossible to leave them open due to street noise (worse for the kids on the street side of hotel). This would be a real problem in warmer weather so if you're a light sleeper ask for a room at the back of the hotel. Can't comment on the hotel breakfast we skipped it and bought from the bakery next door. The desk staff were helpful providing a local map and recommendations on where to find 150+ restaurants/bars within a short walk. If you like middle eastern food, we stumbled across a family run diner a couple streets east of the hotel (Sinibad's Falafel). Gracious hosts and the food was tasty and inexpensive. There are 2 computers in the front lobby with free internet access. Despite the stuffy rooms we loved the location and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but too hot and noisy to sleep”
Reviews.Author: 255100Kate
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the staff were helpful. We paid 5 euros deposit for the kettle and cups for our room. The room on the 6th floor was lovely and clean. It had a flat screen tv and a nice bathroom. The huge downside was that the room, even with the heat off and aircon on was very hot and stuffy. We both caught colds and this made it worse. We had to sleep with the windows open for air, but the street noise went on all night. We were disappointed that this hotel had everything right, but you couldnt get a good nights sleep... at all. 10 mins walk from the hotel, across the street is a great area. The cafes and bars were very good. The underground is outside of the hotel and there is a supermarket on the corner. If they could fix the heating issue, this would be a great place to stay, otherwise its unbearable. If you want wifi in your room, you have to open the window very wide to get the free community wifi.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for 2 nights.”
Reviews.Author: Tony_warks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 17/7/10 and it was 28-30C. Hotel is on a main road which has no parking there. Check-in was easy, Hotel car parking around the back for £12pn. Room 324 was on 3rd floor. Dirty carpets in the corridor. Room was small, clean, tidy, well decorated, no strange smells. Had a bath and shower which were clean. No minbar or tea/coffee. Wall mounted flat TV did not work. Breakfast was good for Europe, self serve. Could not get wi-fi on my Netbook but there is free internet access downstairs. Tube station is right outside the hotel. No issues and a good choice for 2 nights. Tubes are very good and safe in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good value; good staff; good transport link.”
Reviews.Author: KendoMc
Reviews.Content: Great value hotel, nothing fancy, but clean and we had a comfort room at the back, was nice and quiet, although agree with other reviews that the heat builds up in the room, air conditioning was on constantly. Breakfast, at 9 euros a pop, was worth it, with the large selection of buffet on offer, plenty for non meat eaters too! Literally 1 minute from the nearest U bahn station, Samariterstrasse, only a short journey into Alexanderplatz area, from where you can get most places. Mini bar in the room, although when we decided to have a wee beer one night, we opened the beer, only to find some past guest had decided to drink the beer and refill the bottles with water and put the top back on! The reception staff were helpful with this, no questions asked and gave a free replacement from the bar. Rooms decorated a bit bland, perhaps it is due a bit of a make over to brighten it up. Free internet access down on the 2 computers at reception. For something away from the touristy buzz of the centre, we wondered down Gärtnerstraße and found a great wee bar Artliners Berlin, musicians up on stage, good chilled atmosphere, although rather smoky. Along that way is also a good selection of skater style shops.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: StaffordshireChicken
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel and found it excellent value for money. The front desk staff were polite and helpful - ask for a "tea box" on arrival and you will get a kettle, coffee and sugar - take your own teabags as they don't supply English variety and there is a supermarket next door but one for the milk! (There is a mini bar to keep the milk fresh). Comfortable room, ask for "English" type pillows on arrival. Only criticism, there is very little drawer/shelf storage space. Air conditioning worked fine if you take a little time to sort it out. Excellent en suite, with magnifying mirror, and everything spotlessly clean. Would recommend paying an extra 10 euros per night for a quiet room on the back - it's worth it. As other travellers have commented, it is only five stops on the U-bahn to Alexanderplatz. From Schonefeld airport, take the S9 S-bahn to Frankfurter Allee (30 minutes) then transfer to the U2 U-bahn, one stop to Samariterstrasse. When you alight from the train, continue walking along the platform in the direction the train goes, up the steps, left at the top, up more steps and you are 25 metres from the front door of the hotel. We bought a 72 hour City Tour Card at the airport (ABC zones) for 24 euros. This will get you all over Berlin on buses, trains, trams.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but hot and noisy”
Reviews.Author: blaghaus
Reviews.Content: Not much to say other than the rooms were small but perfectly appointed, the bathroom excellent (very strong shower which I loved). The weather has been a little hot for october so the rooms got a bit hot meaning we had to open the window where the street outside is noisy. To be fair, we didn't mind and we could have asked for a fan but were lazy. The amenities are fantastic, with a supermarket right outside open til ten, and a shop open 24 hours over the road. Also you step directly out of the hotel to a U-bahn. The area was fantastic, it's five minutes walk from Simon-Dach-Strasse, where there is much to be enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: i_need_a_coffee
Reviews.Content: Located right next to u-bahn station so very easy to get to/from the airport and city centre. Not too central but very handy for staggering home from the student-y end of town, where we spent most of our evenings. Bakery, off-license and chip shop all nearby which is very handy for cheap breakfast / late night beer. Staff very helpful. Comfy beds and decent shower. My only complaint is that the room was far too hot, so either you had to live with the heat or open the window and try to sleep through the noise. The weird pillows have been mentioned on other reviews. At £116 for 3 nights I'd come back.

Reviews.Title: “Close to metro, grubby hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellingbrummie
Reviews.Content: Great Western need to do a surveilence visit, all of the carpets in corridors and rooms are grubby and haven't been cleaned in ages, there were stains on the room carpets I was too nervous to look closely at. The bathroom could also have done with a good deep clean. Beds were comfy but no pillows, huge cushions were provided on the bed which meant your feet hung over the end of the bed, as the bed base was made from chipboard this was very uncomfortable. Reception informed me no other pillows were available as they had all been taken, however, standing at the reception desk for 10mins staring at the receptionist made 2 pillows appear! It wasn't they hadn't any they were just too lazy to get them. Bar is extention of reception desk and not comfortable, but there are plenty of local bars. A cheap option and metro station just outside the hotel so good location, warning...the drains around the hotel STINK!!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cestovatel_W
Reviews.Content: Hotel’s located 4 subway stations from Alexander Platz (the city center). Actually It’s possible to get in the center by walking for 15 minutes. Subway station’s located near the main entrance to the hotel. Room was simple-designed, but everything was ok – modern design and furniture. Standard double room didn’t have a bath, only shower.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - although rooms at the front are noisy”
Reviews.Author: trainsandpiers
Reviews.Content: Pleasant hotel in good location. It's right next to a metro stop and about 5 minutes to Alexanderplatz by metro. Plenty of useful shops nearby. Rooms were standard but clean and the bed was comfortable. Tasty breakfast with plenty of choice. Only real disadvantage was that it's on a busy road (Frankfurter Allee) and our room at the front was noisy. It also faced the afternoon sun which meant that it got very hot and the air-conditioning wasn't up to much. After 1 night we asked to move to a room at the back - we had to pay more for it, but we slept much better as a result. The reception staff were a bit frosty about this but otherwise were pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen83
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from staying at this hotel and it was great -just what you would expect from a Best Western. The reviews on here are pretty accurate... I had liitle trouble getting from the airport to the hotel, yes you do need to swap trains but as long as you have a map of the metro system it will be fine. If you go to Alexanderplatz you can take the underground to all of the sights- I went to the Brandenburg Gate and then walked to the Reichstag, Berlin Wall, Checkpoint Charlie very easily. Around the hotel there is a Burger King, Subway, Netto, bakery but not much else.... The room does have a safe but your laptop (i had a netbook so very small) will not fit in it, just big enough for a wallet and documents so keep this in mind. The hotel supplies you with a hairdryer, shampoo, conditioner etc but if you want to you use the internet I suggest you take your own cable to connect your laptop to the internet-you can buy them cheapily in England and then you don't have to pay a deposit to use theirs. Overall a good base if you are just spending a few days checking out the sights-make sure you go to the T.V Tower for a great meal looking down on Berlin but make sure you book in advance and also make a trip to Sachenhausen Concentration Camp.

Reviews.Title: “good price, just outside a metro stop”
Reviews.Author: etejoie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outside the city center where most the sites are, but was a very good value. It is right outside a metro stop so it is quite accessible, but you basically have to ride the metro into Alexanderplatz and switch to get anywhere. There is nothing to do in this area. The wait for the metro here can be up to 11 minutes, which I consider long compared to most major European metros. The breakfast was not included, and the rooms were clean but the carpet had some stains. They have a luggage room where you can keep your bags before or after you check in or out.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissPicks
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic locaton directly opposite a metro station that takes you to major sites of Berlin. The rooms are very tidy and exteremly comfertable. The service that was offered by staff was fantastic, they are very friendly and very efficient. I would recommend this hotel to anybody staying in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: ursel16
Reviews.Content: Located in former East Berlin. Great ambiance all around. You get a feel of the real Berlin in this neighborhood. Many stores and cozy cafes within minutes of hotel. Hotel is only steps from next subway station. On a nice day I recommend a walk to Alexander Platz from .Hotel is very clean, functional. The staff pleasant

Reviews.Title: “NOT the best located hotel in berlin”
Reviews.Author: Aberbud
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a great week in Berlin. During our stay we based ourselves at the BW City Ost. largely based on the positive reviews on this site. Sadly, and unusually, I find myself disagreeing with many co-reviewers. The hotel is OK but it is really let down by its location. Berlin is a fun city with loads of exciting bars and restaurants but these are not to be found in the Frankfurter Allee and certainly not in the vicinity of the hotel. This is the "grungy" area of the city and while there are plenty of cafes and bars which might appeal, they are mainly of the student-friendly style that can be found in any city. Apart from one crucial difference - everything closes by midnight! Shopping in this area is of the Netto or Lidl cheap supermarket variety with some niche studenty type thrown in. Others have commented on the proximity of the U-Bahn and they are right - Samariterstrasse station is right outside the front door (don't worry, there is no noise). Unfortunately until the U5 line extension is completed, this line doesn't provide much connectivity with the rest of the excellent integrated Berlin public transport system. Until then, you need to transit through Alexander Platz. We found the reception staff to be very friendly and helpful and all spoke perfect English. The rooms are tiny (we had a comfort room on the 3rd floor, rear). The double bed was actually 2 singles joined together but the bedding was "singles", i.e. 2 single quilts instead of 1 double/king. Strange. This was my first visit to Berlin and I loved it but I cannot recommend this hotel or this district for the first time visitor. When we return to Berlin (and we will) we will probably stay in Mitte or Charlottenburg where there is much more to do.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and superbly situated”
Reviews.Author: kraftwerkfan
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel. It was clean, smart and the beds were good too. Best thing though was the location. I love Friedrichshain and it's walking distance to the best bars and restaurants on Simon Dach Strasse and the surrounding area. It's also on the U-Bahn into Alexanderplatz which makes it perfect for seeing the city. I love Berlin, this hotel is a good one in a great city. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Schnors
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Berlin and having read reviews on Tripadvisor, I opted for this hotel - we were not disappointed. I booked over the internet and got a no cancellation/no change rate of 131euros for 3 nights. The staff were very efficient and the room was excellent, very clean and well appointed. We didn't take advantage of the hotel breakfast as there is a bakery next door, handy for juices, coffee and all the rolls and pastries you could imagine. To the other side of the hotel, there is a little supermarket, where we stocked up on all snacks needed for our excursions throughout the day and opposite the hotel, we found an off-licence that seemed to be open all the time - far cheaper than using the hotel mini-bar. The U-bahn stop (Samaritastrasse) is directly outside the hotel and we found the transport system to be excellent, never waiting more than 3 minutes for a train (even on their bank holiday, Ascension Day on the 13th May). I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel not far from the center”
Reviews.Author: Nakoikaci
Reviews.Content: This is a quiet, clean hotel with private parking not far from Alexanderplatz. The metro station is about 10 steps from the hotel! The rooms are clean, our windows overlooked the street, which was a little noisy. It was not very comfortable, we woke up several times at night (we had to open the window, because the condition didn't work and it was very hot). But our friend stayed in a single room on the other side and her windows overlooked the courtyard and it was quiet there. In general, we liked this place and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: CazMoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights when visiting for the Berlin 25k run. The hotel is situated right outside the eastern end of the Samariterstrasse station on the U5 line. This takes you directly into Alexanderplatz in a few minutes. Well worth buying the Tageskarte to get about each day. Our room was comfortable and the shower was lovely and powerful. Half the rooms have windows onto the busy FrankfurterAllee which was too noisy with the window open, so if you want quieter, best ask for one facing the back. There is a PC with free internet in the reception area and free wifi too. Breakfast was an ample buffet which was kept well stocked up. If you are room only, there is a bakery right outside and a Netto supermarket.. The hotel was a good price and I would say a good tourist class place to stay. The Stasi Museum is not very far away. We chose to eat out locally as we felt that the eateries were tailored more for locals so their prices would be better than touristy places in the centre. We were not disappointed. We tried Sandos (Proskauer Str. 10, 10247 Berlin) the night before our race as we wanted pasta or pizza. The ravioli and linguini were first class. Nice little Café/Restaurant with a rustic feel. We also tried a Vietnamese, Chi Ly (Niederbarnimstraße 17, 10247 Berlin). It was very cheap and good too. There were several other eateries in this street too. The hotel staff are happy to point you in the direction of places to eat. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Sanoca
Reviews.Content: PROS: Location: the hotel has a metro station right at its door (Samariterstrasse in U5) that is really close (5 stations away) from the central hub that is Alexanderplatz.Besides that, next to the hotel there are a lot of commerce, including a supermarket open until 10 pm and a really good and cheap self service bakery, great for having breakfast. Room: the room and bathroom are of a decent size (for european standards) and are well furnished (mini fridge, full lenght mirror, good shower, makeup mirror, confortable bed...) and kept really clean. Quiet: our room was right next to an elevator but we hardly ever heard any noise, it was always super quiet. However, we were not facing the main street, so can´t say what is the noise level in those rooms. Wireless: in all the days we spent there (6 days in May 2010) the free wifi in the rooms was working perfectly. We even got to see an important portuguese football game via net, which was great. CONS: Room Temperature: the hotel, and especially the room, were always super hot and we couldn't find a way to adjust the temperature (so I'm assuming there wasn't). Staff: the reception staff were not very friendly and polite, but they did their job eficiently.

Reviews.Title: “This would be my first choice of hotel on my next visit to Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: Mike B
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to be different to the other very positive reviews. This was an Easter break with my wife - booked at short notice and not expecting much for the money paid - Ryanair and inexpensive hotel. Not only were the flights in and out early, the hotel is in an excellent location, with the U-Bahn outside, and 5 stops to Alexanderplatz. If you have a car there is a car park, and good road connections. We arrived at 10 pm so decided on a taxi from the airport to an area unknown to us. Cost 35 euros! But if you arrive at a more sensible time, we found the public transport system excellent. Worth getting a 16 euro 48 hours pass which lets you jump off underground and surface trains, buses, and trams. (Also longer passes.) To return to the airport (Schönefeld) we jumped on the U5 and then changed to a surface train right into the airport at just 6 euros each. Took about an hour with the change and stops. Experience is a great thing but you could maybe do it quicker by going into Alexanderplatz station and getting the high speed train link. Negatively, if you have a room at the front there may be traffic noise. We were at the back - very peaceful. Staff were all very friendly and helpful, and good English spoken. The hotel bar is not exactly the centre of Berlin night life, but if you want a recommendation nearby (short walk) try Lebowski Bar, Niederbarnim Str. 23, Friedrichshain. Real character bar with great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in good location!”
Reviews.Author: Beside_the_seaside
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a short break in Berlin visiting friends. Location is perfect as the U-Bahn is right outside the front door and within minutes you can get to the Mitte & other parts of Berlin. Locally there's a great bakery, Netto supermarket and several cafes & restaurants all within a couple of minutes walk of the hotel. It's also within walking distance of the up & coming trendy area of Boxhagener Platz and Simon-Dach Strasse. The rooms are no over large but they are very comfortable and nicely designed with flat screen TV's and comfortable beds. You can ask at reception for tea & coffee making sets which you can borrow for a returnable deposit of 5 euros. The shower and bathroom are clean and everything seems pretty new and good quality. The staff are helpful and you can store your luggage with them on the day you check out if you have a later flight and want to see some more of the city before you go. The only complaint I would make is about the temperature but there may be a reason for this! The rooms were really warm and we found ourselves opening the window to cool down but I think this may be because up until a few days before Berlin was freezing. They'd had lots of snow and the temperature was in the minus, however, it had really warmed up when we were there at the end of February, it was actually quite mild so perhaps they had not had time to adjust the room settings. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel 100%.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Gizmo79
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely. The U-bahn is outside the main door and there is a beautiful bakery next door. The Hotle is ideally located as it is not too busy at night but only a few minutes from the city centre. The air con was broken but we opened a window and that sufficed!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean, quiet and located on superb metro system”
Reviews.Author: Cassiu5
Reviews.Content: I must agree with all the previous reviews. I found this hotel to be excellent value and ideally located. The hotel is right on the U5 line of the metro which, in 5 minutes, connects to Alexanderplatz and one of the most comprehensive transportation systems in Europe. I constantly used the metro and easily got my monies worth out of a five day travel card. The hotel was quiet, I was never bothered by other residents even though there were large teenage parties in the hotel (however I was at the end of the 4th floor corridoor which may have helped) The breakfast is good, though maybe a little pricey. A large selection of good meats, cheeses and bread rolls as well as cereals, cooked sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs, yoghurts and cakes etc. Plenty of places to eat in the main street with a couple of excellent and cheap bakeries and pizza places within 5 minutes. Worth exploring down the streets opposite the hotel for more eating places too. Good little shop opposite as well for a huge selection of bottlled beers at around 1E a bottle. Never felt threatened around teh area, even in some of the more "bohemian" streets opposite the hotel Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and would use it again if I return to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: steviet1972
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for exploring Berlin. The tube is very cheap and takes about 20 minutes to cover the total width of Berlin. Hotel room was large, excellent shower and had everything needed. Free internet WiFi is only in the hotel lobby and not in the rooms and the connection speed was very slow indeed (dialup speed). There are literally dozens of great places to eat and shop within a couple of minutes walk and many of them stay open into the small hours so you will never be short of anything. We didn't pay for breakfast as their is a bakery next door and you can get some amazingly fresh tasty items for a couple of Euros. The hotel bar prices are expensive but the Netto supermarket next door sells beer from 26 Euro cents! Would certainly want to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “100% for location & accessibility”
Reviews.Author: G0ingnow
Reviews.Content: Do not worry about the hotel not being in the city centre, Samaritestr. U-Bahn (undergroud) is literally at its door step (mind you, there are 2 exits, the other require ~20steps from the hotel). Given Germany's reputation in automobile (think BMW) and its engineering achievement, the public transporation in Berlin is superb and has one of the best network in Europe. This means there is almost always a train waiting to connect you to the city everytime you step out of Best Western Ost hotel. And for this great accessibility, who needs to stay in the heart of the city, besides, a suburb hotel rate is always more reasonable. compare price using tripadvisor, I got a great rate from Hotels.com. To top it, 2 doors away is a local mini-market, which has long operating hours and will cater for all you basic need from forgottten tooth brush to late night snacks, charging local price and not tourist rate. There are also Burger King and Subway sandwiches nearby. I particularly fancy the bakery across the lane to Burger King, had my breakfast there almost every morning, either dine-in or on-the go. The room is no frill but like most German hotels I read from the review, it is very clean. The room is well insulated, unless u open the window, it is warm and quiet. It meets my high standard for cleaniness. It is exactly like the pictures posted on the hotel website. A few more tips to share:- 1.) Read the info booklet in the room, a lot of amenites not available in the room can be requested from the front desk free of charge. This includes kettle, coffee, tea bags, shower cap, tooth brush & paste, adapter etc. Don't ask me why they are not provided upfront, maybe it is the German way. 2.) Forget about the common pc. It is slow and always hanged. If u really must, bring ur own and u can hook up for free in the room. Too bad no wireless. Couple of things which i think can be improved. 1.) The service. Staffs are not very friendly or approachable. As I mostly travelled in Asia region where people is warmer, I definitely think not greeting ur guest and asking her to bring her own luggage to and from the storage room is out. This is not bad service, there is no service to start with. It will be perfect if u are the type who like to be left alone :) 2.) The TV program. They are >20 channels but all are in German, except for CNN. Despite the above, I like the hotel and will give it 90% for the price I paid. As Asian female travelling solo, I felt the hotel is clean, quiet, comfortable and safe, these are the utmost important.

Reviews.Title: “good location, worth the money spent”
Reviews.Author: jasmy90
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located and we got a very superdeal through expedia. Nice rooms, close to the metro and comfortable. Maybe service is not a priority to them but, they are serviceable. We will go back next year! Thank you. Neil, Joe

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: Greenihan
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading reviews on here. They weren't wrong, the location is ideal for travelling into all the sites of Berlin. Obviously it's not in the heart of the city but then the price reflects that. When you come off the train at Samarite Strasse from the airport, turn left, up the stairs, to the left and the hotel is at the top of the stairs. The entire hotel was very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful and spoke English. You can get a kettle, cups and tea & coffee at the reception for a 5euro deposit and there is a mini bar in the rooms. If you're like us you empty it and fill the fridge with your own stuff!! The breakfast price is a bit steep at 9euro but it was very good and catered for most tastes in my view. My only complaint was the pillows but that has been mentioned so I won't go on, the bed was very comfy though.

Reviews.Title: “Bland, but totally fabulous cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: eekamouse5
Reviews.Content: Less than 10 paces from the U-Bahn, S-Bahn straight to/from the airport, two 24 hour shops directly opposite inc offf licence and chocolate, FAB place for breakfast on the corner, many places to eat at any time, walk to many attractions (Alexanderplatz, Berlin Wall), very friendly & helpful staff, beds are v comfy & pillows fab for watching telly (not so much for sleeping on tho), free access to internet - couldn't ask for more at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: nadianadia99
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. Great deals via online booking ($55 Canadian a night was cheaper than what we'd pay in Canada at a Best Western). Subway station right outside the door makes for convenient transportation. Nice cafe just down the street and great little bakery a couple of doors down. Also walking distance to a street fully of interesting restaurants. Even the street-view rooms were extremely quiet. No need to pay the extra $$ for the inside rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for staying in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Nefeli_5
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean and quite hotel, literally outside the metro. Check the bakery next to it with its yummy stuff. There is a mini market opposite to it open until late.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for the sights”
Reviews.Author: jeff1980
Reviews.Content: Its all been said before but the location is what makes this hotel. Pick the right exit from the U bahn station and its right in front of you. Clean rooms, Quick check in, excellent bathrooms, nice little reception bar which was reasonably priced. Good links from schonefeld airport which is direct to frankfurter alee and then one stop down on the ubahn. Would say head left out of the hotel and keep walking until you hit a main road. Cross over (on your left) and you will find a great little italian (didnt get the name but it was brilliant).

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: gmit
Reviews.Content: A great value for money! Rooms were clean and acceptably large. We could have used a fresh pair of bedclothes, but wasn't a big deal. The location of hotel is fantastic - right next to its front door there is a bakery with coffee and a place to eat some 50+ types of buns. Few meters further, there is a metro station and right across the road, there is a shop opened 24/7 with a large selection of very acceptably priced beers and a fruit store opened 24/7 (who hasn't yearned for a fresh piece of broccoli at 3am?!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great base for getting around”
Reviews.Author: johnrath
Reviews.Content: This review really is just to confirm the really excellent value of this hotel, situated slam bang next to a metro station, which is itself just a little more than 10 minutes ride to Alexanderplatz. The rooms were fine and the service was efficient and friendly. Although there's only one free PC in reception I had absolutely no problem in getting on the internet when I liked. Gym was more of a problem, but a short walk away is a reasonable, but not cheap one, which was pretty friendly. I also found the area around the hotel very good for bars and restaurants, but it's just such a great base for getting around Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot for a reasonably priced holiday Break”
Reviews.Author: ZoeBristol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my teenage daughter last week. Great hotel, very clean and pleasant room, reasonably spacious, excellent bathroom facilities, lovely bedding. The room was cleaned each day and we were given a new supply of fluffy white towels.The U-bahn is right outside the front of the hotel with easy access to all parts of the City. Bakery next door and Supermarket next door but one. Ask for a kettle, which is supplied with mugs coffeee, tea etc for a deposit of 5 euros, so you can have hot drinks in your room. Reception staff were helpful. We didn't eat in the Hotel, but there are lots of places nearby to explore. Thoroughly recommend this hotel. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TinaBull
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in December 2009 during a short trip to see the Christmas Markets & experience the city. Hotel is right outside Sameritstrasse U-Bahn stop which made getting to anywhere in the city easy as the public transport system is really excellent. 10 minutes to Alexanderplatz. Room was a nice size and spotlessly clean, especially the bathroom. Good flat screen tv on the wall. Bed was two singles pushed together which I believe is standard in Germany. Bed was a little firm for my taste and the room was a little too warm but apart from that I really can't fault it. We paid approx €40 for the room per night and for that price we felt it really was excellent value for money. The city is lovely this time of year and they really go all out for Christmas. Try the half metre long bratwurst, the almond flavour mini doughnut pebbles and orange punch - watch out for the kick with that punch though!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect hotel....”
Reviews.Author: nicholasbrennan59
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed with this hotel all around really. Not only was this in a great location (it was right next to the U-Bahn), the staff were extremely helpful with providing information about using the trains and explaining the best places places to visit. if you are on a budget, then i would definately recommend this and if you are not then consider it too! Also you can use the internet free of charge!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: DejanK
Reviews.Content: Very good, inexpensive. Located in famous Frankfurter Allee, extension of Karl Marx Allee, in residential area. Very close to U-Bahn, but also to S-Bahn, which leads directly to Schonefeld airport. Close to Stasi Museum, as well. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Budget Hotel - 2 Seconds from Underground”
Reviews.Author: JohnHunter1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel location was spot on. Literally 2 second from the front door was the U Bahn station and 5 quick stops to Alexanderplatz. 24 hour shops opposite and discount supermarket 2 doors down. Found some good local restaurants and is close to Berghain / Watergate clubs. Location 10/10. I cannot fault our room for the money - spotlessly clean, cumfy bed, flatscreen TV, power shower. Staff friendly and helpful when required. Checked in around 1pm - no problem. Overall for the money I would recommend to anyone on a budget going to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Overheated but great in most ways”
Reviews.Author: SydneyAnnie
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel for a good price well in advance online with Best Western. As others have said the location is wonderful, rooms sparkling clean and the staff helpful. As others have noted heating can be a problem - maybe it is not all rooms. After no sleep due to this on the first night we requested a move and although our new room was still on the street side the heating was better. We were initially told there was an airconditioning problem and you had to sleep with the window open - noisy and drafty and a little wet! Our son had a single room and he had no problem. Very easy to use as a base - can get anywhere quickly, and lots of pleasant eateries around.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Scorpio40
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location for using the U-bahn and S-bahn transport system. We purchased a Berlin Welcome Card from the airport (near the information desk) for 25 euro's each. At first we thought this was alot of money, but we certainly got our money's worth. The book has many discounts for entry for up to 100 places. The transport service is very regular, from outside of the hotel it is only 5 stops to Alexanderplatz and about 10 minutes of a trip if that.
