Don't make the same mistake that we did and wait on the S9 station at the airport going to the hotel, ask! Pick up a map on your way through the airport, you'll need it! The hotel is very warm and clean. Too hot actually, we had to sleep with the window open and the noise from the traffic outside was terrible. You can get nearly everything from the hotel lobby like an ironing board and iron, kettle, tea coffee etc, travel plugs, all for a small deposit. They also have toothpaste, cosmetics, razors and shaving gel etc for free, but beware the razors you can only scrape with once, they were rubbish. The beds were comfortable and so were the pillows. The towels were changed whenever you left them on the bathroom floor. On our last morning there, the maid came into our room at 0715 when we were still in bed, so beware use your 'do not disturb' sign. The trip up the TV Tower was ok, we can say we have been up there, we had a meal in the restaurant as it was my birthday, it was very expensive and nothing fancy, wouldn't go again! There was also a wait to come down in the lift . We went to Sachenhausen Concentration Camp, which was worth the visit. We Got on the S-bahn to Orienburg which took about 40 minutes from Friedrichstrase and then followed the signs to Sachenhausen which took about 15 minutes to walk....easy to find. It was free to get in and you could hire a media player for 3 euros each, one for 2 people is adaquate, you don't need one each. There are toilets when you get there and a cafe, we bought a drink before we set off. If you want to see, hear and listen to everything then give yourself a full day and take some food too. Kilkenny's pub in Mitte is absolutely fabulous, it is located at Hackescher Markt (a main S-bahn station) they have Sky Sports and live bands on 5 times a week, it was warm and welcoming in there and quite busy, very reasonable for prices too, Corona's 3.50 euros each. Potsdam is quite lively too, the Winter Wonderland Market place is really nice, all the smells of the hot food and sweets is fab. Don't go the Radisson hotel to see the fishtank, it's not worth it and you have to pay to view the fish in the middle of the tank, it was 27 euro to enter Sealife!!! If you want to visit the Reichtstag,I would suggest going early, the queues were horrendous, we didn't go for this reason. The Berlin Wall we saw and Checkpoint Charlie.....disappointing, but we've been!! A visit to Dunkin Donuts is a must.....love em!! Mmmmm Great hotel, great location, great price, lots to do, if you go, enjoy. I always read up on other peoples reviews and knew I wouldn't be disappointed with my find at The Best Western Hotel City Ost.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: ColombiaJuanSe
Reviews.Content: What can I say... I booked it online and got a very good bargain, and it's a great value for what it is. I'll make it easy for you in terms of PRO's and CON'S... ... GOOD THINGS: - it's location; just foot steps from Subway and five stops on it to Alexander Platz! - Internet Connection, fast and included in the room's rate - Clean and Comfortable (though single rooms are a bit small) - Friendly Staff, specially the night shift guys are very helpful in terms of giving you directions and maps. That's very convenient! ... NOT PERFECT, BECAUSE... - Rooms a bit small for Best Western standards - No coffee/tea in the room, which is usually expected at these hotels - Breakfast not included! Go there! It's a nice hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Oscar_Doyle
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for two nights and I would find it impossible to think of anything negative to say about our stay. The staff were extremely friendly, spoke perfect English, and were very helpful. The room was spotless and the decor was bright, modern and luxurious. We paid 65E per night for a double room and this was good value for money compared to the price of similar hotels in other cities such as London. Would happily recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, cozy, discreet and at hand”
Reviews.Author: adis001
Reviews.Content: I have chosen this hotel based on users' review on TripAdvisor. I don't regret that. I have never stayed in a German hotel before, and I was a little nervous about the decision. All went well, even the S-bahn timetable disfunctions were fixed by the time we had arrived. As soon as I got to the hotel, I was surprised by the central position and the quality of the neighbourhood. The personnel were kind and warm. We had wireless internet in the lobby and that was all I needed for my smartphone. The room (superior QUIET room) was fine decorated and very quiet as it was facing the courtyard. All was impecable clean. Furniture is new, room is large enough for basic needs. LCD TV with german/international stations. Based on site reviews I had not had breakfast in the Hotel's Restaurant, but rather have bought some food from the extremely nearby supermarket. All in all, it was a good experience and I would definitely recommend this hotel for a short trip to Berlin, tipical bead & breakfast style.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for a short stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: cosmicgirl1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our short trip to Berlin, and had a very good stay. As others have said, the hotel is right next to a u-bahn station, this makes it easy to navigate around the city. The staff were helpful and friendly and most had a good level of English. There were several cafes and restaurants nearby, so we didn't have the 9 Euro breakfast in the hotel. The room itself was quite small, but room enough for our belongings. We were a little worried about it at first, as the room was right next to the lifts, and we thought it may be potentially noisy at night, but we didn't hear them at all - very impressed! It was well cleaned each day, with a comfortable bed, a safe and a good tv. The were only two very minor negatives for me. Firstly, there were no surfaces to put anything on, in the bathroom. Secondly, we asked the reception for a kettle, but they said they were all in use. Maybe it would be more convenient to have a kettle in every room? These were very minor problems though, as we really enjoyed our stay here; a good choice for a short break in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “try east berlin”
Reviews.Author: STARKEY
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in East Berlin(Friedrichshain)but getting around is no problem as the U-bahn station is right outside the hotel.The hotel is on the main road Frankfurter Allee and within a short stroll of many bars and restaurants.Our particular favourite was Lemongrass on Simon Dach Strasse.The room was comfortable and clean and the staff were all very pleasant and helpful.This is definitely a good hotel for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, decent location all round decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liammer
Reviews.Content: Situated 4 stops up from Alexanderplatz on the U5 U-Bahn line makes the hotel fairly well located for many attractions/sites. The TV Tower, many of the museums like the DDR museum for instance walking distance from Alexanderplatz station. The far entrance to Samariterstrasse station is literally only a couple of steps away from the hotel entrance, but mind the mad cyclists in the not so well marked cycle lane! There's a Netto Supermarket a couple of doors away and several bakeries which we used for breakfast instead of the 9 Euro buffet breakfast at the hotel. There's also a Subway Takeway and more eateries a 5 minute walk up Karl Marx Alle to the next U-Bahn station at Frankfurter Alle, where there's also a Kaufhaus Department Store. In the street behind the hotel there's also a few restaurants and mini markets. Freiederichschein bohemian, lots of bars and eateries, area is only a short walk away and you can take a tram to connect to the S-Bahn over the river to the Kreuzberg area from there too. The rooms are fine with decent flat screen TV, reasonable size rooms and bathrooms, not pokey. With a deposit you can loan a kettle so worth investing in some tea or coffee and maybe milk that would fit in the mini bar. The bar area is tiny , just an extension of the reception and the free internet there was a bit hit and miss. There are plenty of 24 internet places in the area though , 50 Cents for 30 mins. Lots of things seemed to be available for free on request to hire eg, irons etc. Some other nice extra touches like leaving a map for the marathon route in each room was good. We did report the light in the bathroom kept cutting out but no-one seemed to follow it up The only real thing which spoilt the stay was the checkout. They tried to charge us for a breakfast (someone had given our room number and you just had to scribble a signature-not the most secure systems). A non existent mobile phone call from the room and items from the mini bar that were not there in the first place were claimed. Leaves a sour taste being looked at like you are a liar. Other than that fully recommended.

Reviews.Title: “you get the feeling you're the first one in the room”
Reviews.Author: sarinni
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how new this hotel is, but other than some small stains on the carpet, you feel like you're the first person to use the room. the bathroom is super super clean and new, the shower has lots of pressure and temperature, you get loads of 'hand, body and hair soap' and plenty of towels the room is spacious, with a big window, clean, furniture looks super clean, sheets are new and clean, you get to choose your pillow from the pillow menu, flat tv.... only small incovenient is: if you're next door neighbours are noisy you can hear them and although the metro station is onw step away from the hotel door, it is not the best of lines, you have to change metro line whatever you do. regarding the breakfast, we followed tips here: we preferred to try other places arround (there are plenty to choose from) also, for people who are used to sleeping in the dark: get an eyemask!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget luxury”
Reviews.Author: brasoygard
Reviews.Content: Clean, normal sized, new rooms with great airconditioning and good bathroom facilities. The hotel has a 24h reception, wich is needed in Berlin. English speaking and nice receptionists.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: toffta
Reviews.Content: The service was overall very good and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms were cleaned daily, unless you left the 'do not disturb' sign on the door... and even then, fresh towels were left in a bag hanging from the door. The room and bathroom were clean, the bed was comfortable, and we had a very quiet stay. The location of the hotel is great, just outside of an underground station. There are lots of eating options in the area, and a Netto grocery store is right next door. The hotel is only a couple of stops from Alexanderplatz. Internet access is free of charge, however, a network cable was needed for internet access from the room. If you don't have one with you, one can be borrowed from the reception for a 5 euro deposit. We didn't use the wireless in the reception area or the breakfast room. Unfortunately, the internet was only working on the first day of our stay. We had a very pleasant trip, and would return to this hotel again. We recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Wish the Internet was working...”
Reviews.Author: CharityK13
Reviews.Content: This Best Western has a lot going for it: comfortable rooms, great bathrooms with excellent water pressure and heated towel racks, and a location convenient to the U-bahn Samariterstrasse. Bear in mind that only the U5 stops at Samariterstrasse, however, so transit in and out of city center requires transfers – at least one and usually two. Nearby restaurants and cafes are very convenient, offering inexpensive meals and fast service. The grocery store located two doors down was helpful. There is a lot of graffiti in this area, however, I understand that this characteristic is indicative of most areas of Berlin. My only real issue with the hotel is that it was advertised as having Wifi access, which was extremely important for the duration of my stay as my partner was working the entire time. When we arrived, we were told that the internet just went down in the entire hotel due to a problem with the provider and that they hoped it would be repaired by the following day. Two more days passed without internet access – two more days spent in the lovely internet cafes down the road, a necessity due to work and one that would have been avoided by being able to work in the evenings, had the internet worked as advertised. I have to admit that we were concerned about access because of a review we read indicating trouble in 2008; however, we took the chance, assured that there would be Wifi on the hotel’s website and in the description on Hotels.com. Even though they said that the internet had just gone down – I found myself wondering if it ever worked at all. Recommended to those who will spend most of their time in East Berlin and who do not require internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: ttdj24
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel from tripadvisor itself, all reviews here are represented of mine...

Reviews.Title: “tube outside the hotel and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: orxidea
Reviews.Content: Mini market was facing a 24-hour around junk food and the attitude at the door of the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great value, perfect neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: MarkBrownAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of the old East Berlin, and is in one of the most fascinating neighborhoods the city has to offer. Be sure to visit the nearby Boxhagener Platz, with its cafes and Bohemian atmosphere...and flea market on Sundays. This is a simple, budget hotel, but at around US$60, it's a great value: wonderful location, very clean room, and friendly/helpful staff. There is a supermarket almost next door, and plenty of restaurants, cafes, and other shopping in the neighborhood. Most importantly, the architecture and history in this thoroughly renovated part of the old East Berlin is impressive. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to tourists. Free internet is also included, but it's not particularly reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - shame our rooms were unavailable!”
Reviews.Author: Cressida
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel well in advance after reading the good reviews and also from previously staying in Best Western Hotels. However, when we arrived on Maundy Thursday evening, we were told that due to a computer error, our rooms were not available (we had to stay elsewhere in a hotel that wasn't as nice). Hotel is right in front of the Samariterstrasse metro, so good transport links. The neighbourhood is also a very interesting (walk towards the tv tower via Karl Marx Allee and notice the change in architecture). Great Italian restaurant on a corner nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location - clean and comfortable in just the right place.”
Reviews.Author: Blueronnie
Reviews.Content: Four of us booked this hotel on the internet for a silly price - through netflights.com. We were a little worried when it seemed to be off the maps we had in our guide books but we worried needlessly. Berlin has a FANTASTIC transport network - buses, trams, underground and suburban trains, so we were only an hour from Tegel airport and just a few minutes from Alexanderplatz (the heart of the transport system). The Best Western is a clean comfortable hotel with a small public area housing a little bar and a few tables and chairs. The rooms are functional, sadly no drink making equipment but that's the continent for you, and kept very clean. We only wanted a place to sleep and shower really so this hotel fitted the bill exactly. Our room was on the third floor looking out over Frankfurter Allee and was a bit noisy late at night but then we were in the middle of a city. The hotel charges 9 euros for breakfast which seemed a bit steep to us with the current exchange rate being about parity so we found a little cafe about 200m towards the city which served us a couple of rolls, salami, jam and coffee for just 3.80 euros each - she called it a French breakfast. Locally there is a Netto, first one I've ever been in... and a 24hr shop across the road in addition to Italian, Indian, Vietnamese and burger restaurants. Some of these aren't top of the range but we weren't on a gourmet holiday. We ate surprisingly cheaply in the local area and went to Zum Nussbaum in Nickolaiviertel one evening as recommended in our guide book. This is a lovely old restaurant but very small; they serve plenty of draught beers and German food at very reasonable prices. Getting around Berlin is so easy - we got a four person ticket for 16 euros and this was valid on all transport for the whole day. We also found the people very friendly and helpful.. We've been to many cities in Europe for short breaks and this is probably the best. There's plenty to see and do and Berlin is a spacious friendly city.

Reviews.Title: “East is Best”
Reviews.Author: GazzatheGrumpy
Reviews.Content: Having stayed out in the East during my last few trips to Berlin, I can heartily recommend this place; it's new, clean and good value plus the U-Bahn U5 station Samariterstrasse is literally outside the front door offering 24-hour a day access to the city (what an amazing concept, transport that runs all night!). The surroundings aren't the most picturesque, but walk into the centre and you'll see the famous "palaces for the workers" on Karl Marx Allee, plus as has already been said the bakery a few doors away is superb for breakfast! So, don't bother with the overpriced breakfast, get a decent rate in advance, and you've got an excellent base for a visit to this fascinating city. For a nearby brewpub (Berlin now has over a dozen!) try Hops & Barley at Wühlischstraße 22, a ten-minute walk away, for delicious beer.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute bargain......”
Reviews.Author: mdstephenson
Reviews.Content: An absolute bargain with spotlessly clean and modern rooms. U-bahn station directly outside the hotel gives rapid access to Alexanderplatz & beyond. The bakery and kebab shop located just yards away also come very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, perfect city hotel”
Reviews.Author: flavell7
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a 3 night break in Berlin with my fiancee. I class myself to be a keen traveller so in a sense i understand what a good city hotel requires. As the hotel is situated a little out of the city i was originally a little worried, also the cost of the hotel was very fair thus adding to my worries! I can honestly say you have nothing to worry about. We flew into Shonefeld airport and used trains/underground to get to the hotel, it was so easy. The underground station (samaristrasse or something) is literally on your doorstep! as is netto (cheap snacks, subway and lots more...) The hotel itself is 5 short stops from alexadarplatz which is a key area in Berlin, and you can connect to any part of the city from there. So location wise its a thumbs up! As for the hotel, overall i was impressed. It's very clean and well maintained, the staff are well manned and friendly and the facilities are what you would expect from a good city hotel. The room was pretty small and so was storage, but we were only staying a short time so this wasnt a problem. Although you are located on a busy road, road noise is minimal due to well glazed windows! 2 minor faults...theres was no bath just a shower (how am i meant to read in the shower!!) and the room was very hot/stuffy due to poor ventilation and i dont think they switch the AC on until summer months! Overall i'd say the hotel was pleasant and excellent value for money, it provided what we needed for our trip and at all times we felt safe and in good hands. As for Berlin...Its cold, but a great city with many things to see and do. I'd greatly recommend the Zoo, its amazing and has pandas!!! Hope this helps :)

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: missholidaygolightly
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel if you like to find hiddens gems of Berlin. The hotel is situated in a bit shabby neighbourhood, but on the other hand you´ll find many interesting and cool restaurants and cafées here. If you want to explore other parts of Berlin the U-bahn is right outside the hotel. I wouldn´t spend 9 euros on the hotel breakfast, try Simon Dachstrasse for nice cafées with lovely brunches and good tasting coffee (a must if you come from Sweden...) The hotel room was fresh and clean. Air condition could be better but not a disaster. Overall a good choice for staying a few nights in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “fast internet, bad ventilation”
Reviews.Author: keijo
Reviews.Content: stayed here for four nites. room was clean if not too well ventilated. the fan could be left on only when occupying the room and it wasn't too effective. no problems regarding heating even though it was snowing outside. nice view over frankfurter allee. the internet was fast, i had to pay a 5 euro deposit to get the ethernet cable. it works so that you have to get a voucher code from the reception, they're valid 24 hours each. if i go there again i ask for enough vouchers at the time of check-in. was good value for money, conveniently located close to the eastern exit of samariterstrasse metro station, near the shops around boxhagener square etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Kikidafrog
Reviews.Content: I am back from there today! It is in the former East Berlin on the Frankfurter Allee. I am fascinated by the former DDR so I was quite happy to stay in this area. It is literally 2 steps to the subway station,Samariterstrasse. It is 5 stops on the U5 to Alexanderplatz and you can get a train anywhere to anywhere in Berlin from there. If you haven't booked breakfast,there is a shopping centre (very small) about 100 yards there that do really nice breakfasts for about 4 euros. There is an Italian restaurant called Mona Lisa on next corner and the food was pretty ok.Apart from that,the area is a bit basic for food,or maybe we didn't explore far enough. There is a 24 hours off licence across the road and a couple of supermarkets nearby where you can get some wine/beer if you can't be bothered going out much past 11 o clock, and don't want to pay the hotel prices! Kebab shop 2 doors away. We went back to hotel about 10.30/11ish most nights and had a drink in room as it was -7c, plus very tired after sightseeing all day. The room was nice-it is not 5 star stuff but beds were very comfortable, and breakfast was good enough. Free net access in lobby,but there may be a queue to get on. Beds were 2 singles pushed together,but as I have a husband who is a quilt thief,it was great!. lovely hot shower and hairdryer in bathroom.Comfiest pillows ever in a hotel! If you want tea and coffee in room,you need to ask reception and pay a 5 euro deposit and get a box containing your kettle and mugs etc. Staff friendly and helpful.It isn't a luxury hotel but for a cheap holiday,it isn't a pit either and was great value.I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irena_Dior
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel for the best price. I booked directly using early web offer. I was worried if location would not be far from city center.. and I was so glad, that U station was 2 steps from hotel. great. Just came out from hotel and you pop into metro station, 2 sec and you in the city centre. Excellent! The hotel itself nice, cosy, rooms clean, nice colors. not noizy if you keep your window closed.. warm i really liked and friends of mine as well. I was so suprised by finding rooms service 24 hours in 3 star hotel. I highly reccomned this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: f44444444f
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and it was great!! It is literally right outside the subway station which was good. The location of the hotel is a little bit out of town and you always have to change stations to get there but it was not a big hassel as it was great value for money. They ask you if you want to buy breakfast when you check in. It's only 6euro a day for breakfast but you have to get it for your whole stay. If you decide to skip breakfast you can still get it on the day but it will be 9euros. We did not get the breakfast so I cannot comment on the food. The rooms were good, everything was new and very clean, the bed was two twin beds pushed together. There was a tiny tiny gap between the beds but you don't really notice. It was very comfortable. The bathrooms was clean and the shower was good. The only thing I would say is confusing is that they offer free internet, you can use wifi in the lobby but have to ask the receptionist for the password. Or you can put a deposit down for a cable and use the internet on a computer in your room. It was all free but a bit of a hassel

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Hotel City Ost - nice place(clean quiet friendly)”
Reviews.Author: Intelins
Reviews.Content: Best Western Hotel City Ost is a nice place to stay on Frankfurter Allee one of the main avenues back in old East-Berlin. The hotel is directly on a subway-station and taxis take 5mins to get you to Alexanderplatz. Nice Hotel also to discover Kreuzberg or Prenzlau as these areas are relatively close by. I stayed there one night. It's clean its ok maybe nothing totally special but clean friendly and tidy and thats what matters.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: MARCKRAJEWSKI
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western City Ost from 13th - 16th September. On arrival at the hotel was greeted at reception by polite and courteous english speaking staff. The room whilst small was clean and comfortable with all the facilities you would normally expect, mini bar, tv etc... There was no bath just a shower. Breakfast was not the best I have had in Germany and was quite basic. It was far more cost effective for us to eat out. The hotel is in a central location 15 mins walk from Alexanderplatz, The East side gallery and Ostbahnhoff station. The hotel is immediately outside Samariterstraße on the U5 about 5 stops from Alexanderplatz. When exiting the U Bahn station ensure that you exit on the right and that way you do not have to cross the buisy road.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: DCoopUlster
Reviews.Content: Love Berlin and was over for a relatives birthday and the Livepool v Hertha pre-season game. Location: Not central so best to use taxi's or the U-Bahn.Samariterstraße stop is right outside the hotel and its only a couple of stops to Alexanderplatz were you can then connect to anywhere you want to in Berlin. Staff: Had abit of a problem with confirmng check-in and one particular member of staff was quite sharp and rude with their manner but managed to get it sorted out with another member of staff and had no further problems with them. Rooms: Nice, bright and clean and had all the usual things you would expect..air-con was definitely a plus, flat-screen tv (although only english speaking channels was the news), nice bathroom with shower and bath. Amenities: Breakfast room on 1st floor, very basic. Just a wee tip, instead of getting a breakfast if you go next door to the bakery shop you can get yourself sorted their for a fraction of the price. Also if you use the U-Bahn and return to Samariterstraße make sure when you get off the metro you use the right exit then turn left at the top of the steps so you end up outside the hotel, if you use the left exit from the metro you'll end up quite abit away from the hotel (as my girlfriend and i found out lol )

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: craigpatt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good if you are looking for a well priced, comfortable, clean, safe and convenient stay in Berlin. The tube station is right outside the hotel. I'd definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: CarloMarcelo
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon the BW Hotel City Ost while looking for hotels in Berlin. With the good experience I've had in my previous stays in BW hotels, I booked this hotel for a weekend. We stayed just one night, but it was enough to experience the strong points of this hotel. Location is good - it was just next to a U Bahn station. The room is very clean and well maintained. We opted not to have breakfast in the hotel, but we took a peek at the sunny breakfast room at the penthouse. Best of all, you get all these at a very affordable rate. I'd definitely go back and would recommend it to my friends. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “save you time and money? stay in another hotel, you deserved better”
Reviews.Author: Viajandoporeruopa
Reviews.Content: The worst staff ever!! I'm serious. I was sick and they treat me really bad, not helpfull at all. Rooms are smelly, breakfast is good but no natural fruit. It is not worth it I would have rathered to stay in a youth hostel... Think about it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: caraheartstravel
Reviews.Content: On a first visit to Germany, and thoroughly unfamiliar with Berlin's neighborhoods, we were thrilled with the location and accommodations at the Best Western. While we usually opt for smaller, non-chain hotels as budget travelers, the Best Western was the perfect place to stay for a five-day stop in Berlin. The hotel must have just opened as our room looked like it had never been used before. Key-card entry and light switches, very comfortable bed and linens, modern yet comfortable design, good-sized bathroom, immaculate house keeping. Though it faced the street with large windows, we heard little to no street noise from the 4th floor. Elevators were nice for luggage. We paid something like 40 euro/night, which for the neighborhood was an absolute steal. U-bahn literally steps from the door and S-bahn a few blocks away, easy access to the Hauptbanhof and airport. Front desk staff was helpful, though it seemed they had some "new hotel" types of problems with other guests (lost reservations, mix-ups, etc). But our reservation was without any problems, so no complaints to that end. I would most certainly stay again, even if the price were higher. A few tips: We skipped breakfast at the hotel in favor of a nice bread shop a few doors down, you can't miss it -- fresh bread, sandwiches, and drinks for extremely cheap. If you're also a budget traveler, there's a grocery store in the mall/shopping center on the way to the S-bahn (left from the hotel door) with plenty of good breakfast/snack options. If you're staying for a few days, definitely purchase the "Welcome Berlin" card, as it's really nice to hop on and off transportation without worrying about tickets, and the card will get you discounts to walking tours and other attractions. A few blocks from the hotel is Simon-Dach-Strasse, with plenty of bars and cheap cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, okay price”
Reviews.Author: fotolovkyne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated, directly above metro station, so you can get easily to the centre etc. My room was smelling a little bit strange like urine (may be some chemicals?), but otherwise it was clean. I had a street view, but I can say that the room was very quiet. Language skills (english) of the stuff were not really strong and it also took them ages to find for me information about a train connection and finaly they find connection to a city that I didn't ask for. But generaly the whole stay was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NCSUfashion
Reviews.Content: This was a great basic hotel, clean, new everything worked. Rooms were a decent size. For breakfast you has several options. Also a U-bahn stop literally as soon as you step out the front door. The front desk staff spoke English and were very helpful. My room faced the main street but I didn't hear any of the traffic at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel!”
Reviews.Author: my_travel_plan
Reviews.Content: Stopped for 3 nights at the Best Western City Ost Hotel, Berlin in April 2008. What a great find! Metro stop outside hotel entrance, only 5 stops from Alexanderplatz. Staff friendly and helpful at all times. Travelled alone - had a double room which was clean, roomy and included a flat screen TV. Heated towel rail in bathroom. Shower but no bath, hair dryer included. Had a room on the top floor (6th) which was at front of hotel but quiet. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for good value accomodation in Berlin. Don't bother with the limited breakfast in the hotel - plenty of places to eat in Berlin. There were some opening offers avaliable for this hotel which were 30% off 3 night stay or one nights free on some websites. Should I go back to Berlin I will use this hotel again! No problem in recommending to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Just back from Best western Berlin ost”
Reviews.Author: berlinensemble
Reviews.Content: Well last monday 7th/04/08 the wife and I had a break from work at the same time and decided that we would take a trip to Berlin , a place we had talked about , but had never gotten around to doing. Here was our chance , On the spur of the moment , we booked on the sunday night and was there on the Monday early evening. The people at the desk where very friendly, polite, helpful and spoke English very well. The double room we booked was very clean and comfortable, large flat tv screen on the bedroom wall , and wireless internet also. Shower and toilet room was of fair size and also very clean. The place has a "NEW" feel about it, and with a little bit more time behind it, it will surely start to develop its own character. Underground access right outside of the main door means it was simple to get to anywhere in Berlin. check out the Mona Lisa Pizzaria , go out the main Hotel entrance and turn right, walk a few yards and there it is. If you like Pizza you will love this place. My wife is a very good cook and very fussy when it comes to food and she loved the vegetarian and the plain old Margharita pizzas here. Fresh ingredients made it a heavenly delight.They also do other food. But back to the Best Western , im sure its star rating will rise , theres nothing wrong with the place. Depends what you want from a hotel , but if its a comfortable clean room with facilities and a great place to explore Berlin from. This is not a bad place to be. We will certainly return to this hotel on our next trip to Berlin. Greetings from Denmark.
